meanings.definition: a horizontal bar with a vertical support at each end, for carrying by hand
meanings.sent1: I used the handlebar to lift the heavy box off the ground.
meanings.sent2: The handlebar of the suitcase made it easy to carry through the airport.
meanings.sent3: The handlebar helped me transport the groceries from the car to the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her grip on the handlebar was firm as she moved the furniture around the room.
meanings.sent5: The handlebar was a convenient tool for moving the ladder to the backyard.

meanings.definition: a curved bar at the front of a bicycle or motorcycle that the rider holds onto while riding
meanings.sent1: The handlebar on my bike allows me to steer easily on the road.
meanings.sent2: He tightly gripped the handlebar as he sped down the hill on his bicycle.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to hold onto the handlebar of the bike for a fun ride.
meanings.sent4: The handlebar of the motorcycle felt like a powerful extension of his arms.
meanings.sent5: She felt the wind in her face as she leaned into the handlebar during the race.
